questions.prompt: When is a direct free kick awarded?

options.A: For a goalkeeper holding the ball more than 6 seconds
options.C: For a handball by an outfield player

questions.explanation: Handball is a direct free-kick offense; dangerous play without contact is an indirect free kick, and offside is also indirect.

questions.prompt: What’s the minimum duration of a halftime interval in a standard 90-minute match?
questions.explanation: Law 7 sets halftime at “not more than 15 minutes” (but not less than 15 in standard competitions).

questions.prompt: If the ball hits the referee and goes directly to a goal, what’s the restart?

options.C: Indirect free kick to defending team

questions.explanation: Since 2019, play stops and restarts with a dropped ball when the ball strikes the referee and one team immediately gains an advantage.

questions.prompt: What’s the most effective body part to cushion a high, lofted pass?
questions.explanation: Using the chest allows you to absorb force and bring the ball down under control.

questions.prompt: When passing at speed, which technique improves accuracy?

options.D: Pointing your non-kicking foot away from target

questions.explanation: A firm, locked ankle gives a flat striking surface for a more accurate pass.

questions.prompt: In a one-two (“wall pass”), after your first pass you should…
questions.explanation: You “give and go,” creating separation from a defender to receive the return.

questions.prompt: Which move is best for quickly changing direction?
questions.explanation: A drag back (pulling the ball behind your standing foot and turning) is compact and sudden.

questions.prompt: What’s the main purpose of close-control dribbling?

options.C: To maintain possession in tight spaces

questions.explanation: Close touches help you navigate crowded areas without losing the ball.

questions.prompt: When performing an inside-outside dribble, you use the…

options.A: Inside of the foot, then sole
options.B: Inside of the foot, then outside of the same foot
options.C: Outside of the foot, then inside of the other foot
options.D: Sole, then outside of the foot

questions.explanation: The inside-outside feints shift the ball laterally to wrong-foot the defender.

questions.prompt: When performing an inside-outside dribble, you use the…

options.A: Inside of the foot, then sole
options.B: Inside of the foot, then outside of the same foot
options.C: Outside of the foot, then inside of the other foot
options.D: Sole, then outside of the foot

questions.explanation: The inside-outside feints shift the ball laterally to wrong-foot the defender.

questions.prompt: What is “zonal marking”?
questions.explanation: Instead of man-marking, players guard zones and pick up attackers entering them.

questions.prompt: In a 4-3-3 formation, the “6” role usually refers to…
questions.explanation: The single pivot (“number 6”) shields the back four and recycles possession.

questions.prompt: Why might a coach use an asymmetric formation?

options.B: To strengthen an overload on one flank
options.D: To increase speed down the center

questions.explanation: Asymmetry can create 2-v-1 or 3-v-2 situations on one side.

questions.prompt: Which drill best develops anaerobic endurance?
questions.explanation: Short, intense efforts with brief recovery tax the anaerobic system.

questions.prompt: What’s the ideal recovery time between maximal sprint efforts in training?
questions.explanation: Full recovery restores phosphocreatine, enabling repeated maximal efforts.

questions.prompt: Which component is NOT part of a dynamic warm-up?
questions.explanation: Long static stretches can reduce muscle power; dynamic mobility is preferred pre-game.
